creator: takashi.asfbugzilla@tks.st
text:
If you write to httpd.conf:
RewriteEngine On
RewriteRule ^/foo/$ http://example.com/ [L, R]

then you will get:
Syntax error on line 32 of /usr/local/apache2/conf/httpd.conf:
RewriteCond: bad flag delimiters

RewriteCond?

This error message is in the function cmd_parseflagfield, 
which is called by both RewriteCond and RewriteRule.

creator: m_vitaly@topixoft.com
text:
Created attachment 22452
patch for 2.2 HEAD

Provided patch fixing the error string returned by RewriteRule and RewriteCond.

This patch is against 2.2 HEAD, I have another one for trunk and 2.2.9. If you need I can upload binaries.

Please check it...
Please NEVER ever reassign bugs. Otherwise bugs@httpd.apache.org is no longer informed about changes on this bug and it completely falls of the developers radar.
creator: rpluem@apache.org

text: If the patch was commited to the code base, shouldn't the bug's status be changed to RESOLVED/FIXED ?
creator: m_vitaly@topixoft.com
